result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Harold E Sims

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on November 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

2:50 PM Defendant Harold E Sims not in court.  Attorney Pablo Galaviz in court for Harold E Sims.  Prosecuting attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Harold E Sims not in court. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense believes that the Defendant is in the hospital or bedridden at home. Defense has been trying to assist in getting competency evaluation set up. 

State requests that a capias be issued, as medical documentation has not been provided to him. 

Court will set another date, and asks that the Defense file some documents re: the Defendant's medical status. Court will take capias under advisement.
Review hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Letter dated 10/04/2022, filed by Dr Collins, Competency Evaluation Status Letter
Letter dated 09/14/2022, filed by Dr Collins, regarding the status of the competency evaluation

10:58 AM Defendant Harold E Sims not in court.  Attorney Pablo Galaviz in court for Harold E Sims. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marruto.  

Matter called to address the doctor's report on competency.  State indicates they are in compliance with victims rights in this matter.  Court notes a letter was filed by Wisconsin Forensic Unit stating they have not yet been able to complete the evaluation due to the defendants hospitalization.  Attorney Galaviz states the defendant was just released from the hospital and is unable to come to Court due to being bedridden.  Attorney Galaviz requests to toll any time limits to give the department more time to complete the evaluation which will likely have to be at his home.  State is in agreement and requests an adjournment.  Court will toll the time limits for an examination for the outpatient order and will communicate to Wisconsin Forensic Unit that the defendant is available in his home to have the evaluation done.  The Court will set a new date in 30 days to evaluate the status of the defendant and if the evaluation was able to be completed.  If applicable, the Court will allow the defendant to appear by zoom if this is possible.
Review hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Review hearing on October 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Letter dated 08/29/2022, filed by Dr Niess regarding status of investigation
Review hearing on September 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.
signed competency order
Proposed Competency Order

ADDRESS INFO for Harold E Sims
Current: 1001 Delafield St,#301, Waukesha, WI 53188   (Effective: 08-04-2022)
Prior: 1001 Delafield St,#301, Waukesha, WI 53188

10:36 AM Defendant Harold E Sims appeared by Zoom with attorney Pablo Galaviz who appeared by Zoom.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  DEFENSE COUNSEL REQUESTS ORDER FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days.  The Court will set this matter before the Trial Court for review on competency.  Review hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:46 AM  Defendant Harold E Sims in court via his daughter by zoom audio with attorney Pablo Galaviz in person.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Galaviz states the defendant has a medical condition.  Court adjourns for zoom appearance by Atty. Galaviz and defendant.  Hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on July 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $150.00 per month commencing August 1, 2022.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: 01:28 PM Defendant Harold E Sims in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $150.00 per month commencing August 1, 2022.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

For Non-Appearance.
